roleset.name: look at again

roles.note: arg2 would be better as an attribute, and would match VNcls that way, but oh well.

example.name: simple transitive
example.text: Late yesterday, Georgia Gulf said it reviewed the NL proposal as well as interests from ``third parties'' regarding business combinations.
example.arg: the NL proposal as well as interests from ``third parties'' regarding business combinations

example.name: with benefactive
example.text: ``We consider that his bid is an acceptable bid,'' said Sandra Kolber, spokeswoman for [the independent directors' committee]-1 appointed *trace*-1 last May to solicit and review bids for the company in the wake of a dispute between Mr. Drabinsky and Cineplex's major shareholder, MCA Inc.
example.arg: in the wake of a dispute between Mr. Drabinsky and Cineplex's major shareholder, MCA Inc

example.name: with purpose adjunct
example.text: Meanwhile, U.S. Attorney Jerry Rafferty in Denver is reviewing the report prepared by MiniScribe's outside directors, to determine if criminal charges should be brought before a grand jury.
example.arg: U.S. Attorney Jerry Rafferty in Denver
the report prepared by MiniScribe's outside directors
to determine if criminal charges should be brought before a grand jury

example.name: another kind of purpose adjunct
example.text: John reviewed his notes for errors.

roleset.note: The logic here is: "John reviewed his notes to find errors." VN updated by Julia. Member of Vncls 34.1.

predicate.note: Frames file for 'review' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet class 34.1, no indication of other members.
